chamber.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an enclosed space, especially in your body or inside a machine
chamber.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a room used for a special purpose, especially an unpleasant one
chamber.translation[0].definitions[1].no: gas/torture chamber (=used for killing people by gas or for hurting them)
chamber.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a large room in a public building used for important meetings
chamber.translation[0].definitions[3].de: one of the two parts of a parliament or of the US Congress. For example, in Britain the upper chamber is the House of Lords and the lower chamber is the House of Commons.
chamber.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a word used in the past to mean a bedroom or private room
chamber.translation[0].definitions[5].de: the part of a gun where you put the bullets
